Posted By: jlowther (5/7/2011 9:53:17 PM)

posts.post_content:
You gotta love the flavor regarding Karn's time travelling.  
  
First ability: It affects cards in hands, spells that are still yet to come, the **future**.  
Second ability: It affects permanents that exist in the battlefield right now, the **present**.  
Third ability: It restarts the whole battle from the very beginning, going back to the **past**.  
  
EDIT: @Wraique As a matter of fact, he did, so he could save Jhoira from being killed by a Phyrexian agent. Heck, the only reason Urza ever made Karn out of silver was because it's the only thing that can go through temporal energies unscratched.
posts.html:
You gotta love the flavor regarding Karn's time travelling.

First ability: It affects cards in hands, spells that are still yet to come, the future.
Second ability: It affects permanents that exist in the battlefield right now, the present.
Third ability: It restarts the whole battle from the very beginning, going back to the past.

EDIT: @Wraique As a matter of fact, he did, so he could save Jhoira from being killed by a Phyrexian agent. Heck, the only reason Urza ever made Karn out of silver was because it's the only thing that can go through temporal energies unscratched.

posts.post_content: OK, so you build a deck around Karn. Sure, that's not surprising. Best thing to do, though, is exile your own cards with it - First pick is, of course, Another Karn. Because nothing quite says "I hate you" like exiling their first permanents. Second pick can be something simple like [Thrummingbird](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrummingbird) so, with some other proliferate effects, you can continue to exile their permanents (Just need to proliferate three times per turn). Or, alternately, you can of course go for Blightsteel. But that's just overkill.
posts.html:

Posted By: Aun (5/13/2011 6:46:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: His 2nd ability is awesome! It's like a spine of Ish with a Vindicate. And even better, you only pay 7 mana once, something you need Venser or alike to do with Spine. Sick in itself! Ult is Insurance and it slows down your opp or at least makes em' think twice about whatever they play. And if you combo him with Venser, he's pretty much safe keeping. I really like this card. He does so much and the fact that he's colorless makes him playable in almost any deck. He's going to redefine how removal is done for yrs to come in this game. Top 3 PW's for sure, arguably 2nd best.
posts.html:

Posted By: ZestuXIII (5/10/2011 10:09:54 AM)

posts.post_content:
I just realized something, forgive me if everyone else already knew this and I'm being retarded.  
  
Infect is a damage replacement ability, in that creatures with infect don't actually do any damage to a player, they just get poison counters. To damage a planeswalker, damage must go through the player. But planeswalkers can't get poison counters, and -1/-1 counters wouldn't matter either. Are infect decks incapable of damaging planeswalkers?
posts.html:
I just realized something, forgive me if everyone else already knew this and I'm being retarded.

Infect is a damage replacement ability, in that creatures with infect don't actually do any damage to a player, they just get poison counters. To damage a planeswalker, damage must go through the player. But planeswalkers can't get poison counters, and -1/-1 counters wouldn't matter either. Are infect decks incapable of damaging planeswalkers?
